top_categories.workout_context: 65ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Oregon Gran Fondo's Cascade foothills, Forest roads forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 62 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Oregon Gran Fondo's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
When someone attacks on cascade foothills gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
At Oregon Gran Fondo, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Oregon Gran Fondo. Train it until it feels boring.
62 miles on cascade foothills gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Varied gradients on cascade foothills gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Oregon Gran Fondo, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on cascade foothills gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Base fitness for Oregon Gran Fondo. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Oregon Gran Fondo’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Oregon Gran Fondo. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Oregon Gran Fondo requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on cascade foothills gravel to build confidence. Expect: cascade foothills, forest roads, rolling to hilly.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 62 miles of cascade foothills gravel in Cottage Grove, Oregon.
